channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Shadow Dollar That's Fueling the Financial Underworld
item.description: Cryptocurrency Tether enables a parallel economy that operates beyond the reach of U.S. law enforcement.

item.title: Musk’s SpaceX launches historic Polaris Dawn for first commercial space walk
item.description: Elon Musk’s SpaceX completed the first launch of the private Polaris Program early Tuesday carrying four astronauts who will undertake the first comme...

item.title: The Boom in Zero-Day Options Is Coming for Tesla and Nvidia
item.description: Brokers and exchanges discuss expanding #0dte to options on individual stocks.

item.title: ‘I have zero regrets’: I’m 84 and estranged from my two adult sons. My 48-year-old wife will get my seven-figure estate. Is that selfish?
item.description: “My will and trust will exclude everyone that carries my family name.”

item.title: China Harnesses a Technology That Vexed the West, Unlocking a Treasure Chest
item.description: Chinese companies are dominating a crucial industry by accessing a new source of minerals needed for electric-vehicle batteries.

item.title: ‘I fear that our democracy could be undermined by nefarious agents’: Is it unethical — or selfless — to anonymously donate to a political party?
item.description: “I’m obsessed over how much money the respective political parties, the Democrats and the Republicans, are generating in donations.”

item.title: A Guide to Why You Should Buy Bonds (and Why You Shouldn't)
item.description: Bonds have regained the haven property that made them desirable for 60/40 portfolios. But that may not matter as much as usually believed.

item.title: ‘My husband blew a gasket’: I bought a $20,000 Toyota SUV using financing. My spouse said, ‘Pay it off immediately.’ Did I get a bad deal?
item.description: “I couldn’t get a cashier’s check at the dealer yesterday as I had my four kids with me.”

item.title: September Is Once Again a Tough Month for Stocks
item.description: The S&P 500 fell 4.2% last week on concerns about the health of the U.S. economy. Going back to 1928, September has been stocks’ weakest month of the ...

item.title: ‘I’m trapped between warring siblings’: My late father left a ledger with $80,000 in unpaid loans to my brothers. Can the executor force them to pay?
item.description: “His will states that his estate is to be divided equally among his five children.”
